newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia raises February palm olein export tax.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia raises February palm olein export tax.

text.p: Indonesia's export tax on RBD palm olein has been raised to $64.40 per tonne in February from $47.60 in January, the Finance Ministry said on Friday.
The tax on crude palm oil was raised marginally to $47.84 per tonne in February from $46.80.
The ministry said the tax on RBD palm oil was increased to $52.52 in February from $39.76, while that on crude olein was raised to $63.05 from $51.10.

The export taxes, introduced in September 1994, are based on a composite average of international prices in the last two weeks of the previous month and are aimed at ensuring sufficient supply and stable prices in the domestic market.
